intro: Ditaxis simoniana, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are clustered in umbels and display shades of pink to purple. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, flat seeds with tufts of hair for wind dispersal.
